title: Establishing scientific exchange and collaboration on crop science between Rothamsted Research and the University of Colombo, Sri Lanka
impactText: Dr Muttucumaru was made redundant in 2013 and this has made follow-up very difficult
findingsText:
Dr Muttucumaru established contacts with:
Dr Jayasekera and research team, University of Colombo
Institute of Biochemistry, Molecular Biology and Biotechnology (IBMBB), University of Colombo
Sirimali Fernando, the Chairperson of the Sri Lankan National Science Foundation
Professor Monte Cassim, member of the Global Forum, Vice-Chancellor of the Ritsumeikan Trust, and Professor at the Ritsumeikan Asia Pacific University, Japan.

She also met with other senior plant science faculty members of the University of Colombo
The Deputy Vice-chancellor of the University of Colombo
A representative of the Tea Research Institute of Sri Lanka
Dr Dhammika N. Gunasekera and Dr Dharshan De Silva of Genetech
Mr. Asoka Gopallawa, the Chairman of the National Agribusiness Council There are clearly overlaps in the interests of Rothamsted Research and some of the research teams working in Sri Lanka. It had been hoped that a scientists from Sri Lanks could visit our lab under a Rothamsted International Fellowship. However, Dr Muttucumaru was made redundant in 2013, which meant that the contacts that had been made were broken. Agriculture, Food and Drink
